s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BRAKE MASTER CYLINDER SUB-ASSEMBLY (w/o ABS)

s2.ptxt: Install a new O-ring to the master cylinder.
Install the master cylinder and bracket (with 4-way) to the booster with the 2 nuts.
Using a union nut wrench, connect the 6 brake lines labeled C to the brake master cylinder and 4-way.

atten3.ptxt: Use the formula to calculate special torque values for situations where a union nut wrench is combined with a torque wrench (See page ).

s2.ptxt: Connect the brake fluid level warning switch connector labeled B to the master cylinder.
for Manual Transmission:
Connect the clutch reservoir tube labeled A to the master cylinder.

s-1.ptxt: INSTALL BRAKE MASTER CYLINDER SUB-ASSEMBLY (w/ ABS)

s2.ptxt: Install a new O-ring to the master cylinder.
Install the master cylinder and bracket (with 3-way) to the booster with the 2 nuts.
Using a union nut wrench, connect the 5 brake lines labeled C to the master cylinder and 3-way.

atten3.ptxt: Use the formula to calculate special torque values for situations where a union nut wrench is combined with a torque wrench (See page ).

s2.ptxt: Connect the brake fluid level warning switch connector labeled B to the master cylinder.
Connect the clutch reservoir tube labeled A to the master cylinder.

specitem.ptxt: SAE J1703 or FMVSS No. 116 DOT3

s-1.ptxt: BLEED AIR FROM BRAKE MASTER CYLINDER

atten4.ptxt: If the master cylinder has been disassembled or if the reservoir becomes empty, bleed air from the master cylinder.

s2.ptxt: Using a union nut wrench, disconnect the 2 brake lines from the master cylinder.
Slowly depress and hold down the brake pedal.
Cover the outer holes with your fingers, and release the pedal.
Repeat the 2 previous steps 3 or 4 times.
Using a union nut wrench, connect the 2 brake lines to the master cylinder.

atten3.ptxt: Use the formula to calculate special torque values for situations where a union nut wrench is combined with a torque wrench (See page ).

s2.ptxt: Remove the bleeder plug cap.
Connect a vinyl tube to the bleeder plugs.
Depress the pedal several times, and then loosen the bleeder plug with the pedal depressed.
When fluid stops coming out, immediately tighten the bleeder plug. Then release the pedal.
Repeat the 2 previous steps until all the air in the brake fluid is gone.
Tighten the bleeder plug.
Install the cap.
Bleed air from the brake line for each wheel by repeating the above procedures.
Remove the brake master cylinder reservoir filler cap assembly.
Add brake fluid to keep the level between the MIN and MAX lines of the reservoir while bleeding the clutch line.

specitem.ptxt: SAE J1703 or FMVSS No. 116 DOT3

s2.ptxt: Remove the bleeder plug cap.
Connect a vinyl tube to the bleeder plug.
Depress the clutch pedal several times, and then loosen the bleeder plug with the pedal depressed.
At the point when fluid stops coming out, tighten the bleeder plug, and then release the clutch pedal.
Repeat the previous 2 steps until all the air in the fluid is completely bled out.
Tighten the bleeder plug.
Install the bleeder plug cap.
Check that all the air has been bled out of the clutch line.
Check for brake fluid leaks.
Check the brake fluid level in the reservoir (See page ).
Install the brake master cylinder reservoir filler cap assembly.

s-1.ptxt: CHECK BRAKE FLUID LEVEL IN RESERVOIR

s2.ptxt: Check the fluid level and add fluid if necessary.

specitem.ptxt: SAE J1703 or FMVSS No. 116 DOT3

atten4.ptxt: Add fluid to a level between the reservoir's MIN and MAX lines.
